Package org.cesecore.keys.validation

Interface KeyValidatorSession

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    KeyValidatorSessionLocal, KeyValidatorSessionRemote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    KeyValidatorSessionBean
    public interface KeyValidatorSession
    Interface for key validator operations.
    Version:
    $Id: KeyValidatorSession.java 26986 2017-11-02 15:25:29Z bastianf $

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int addKeyValidator​(AuthenticationToken admin, Validator validator)
      Adds a key validator to the database.
      void changeKeyValidator​(AuthenticationToken admin, Validator validator)
      Updates the key validator with the given name.
      void flushKeyValidatorCache()
      Flushes the key validators cache to ensure that next time they are read from database.
      Map<Integer,​Validator> getAllKeyValidators()
      Retrieves a Map of all key validators.
      String getKeyValidatorName​(int id)
      Gets the name of the key validator with the given id.
      Validator getValidator​(int id)
      Gets a key validator by cache or database.
      void removeKeyValidator​(AuthenticationToken admin, String validatorName)
      Removes the key validator data equal if it is not referenced by a CA.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllKeyValidators

        Map<Integer,​Validator> getAllKeyValidators()
        Retrieves a Map of all key validators.
        Returns:
        Map of BaseKeyValidator mapped by ID.

      • getValidator

        Validator getValidator​(int id)
        Gets a key validator by cache or database.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of a validator
        Returns:
        a BaseKeyValidator or null if a key validator with the given id does not exist. Uses cache to get the object as quickly as possible.

      • getKeyValidatorName

        String getKeyValidatorName​(int id)
        Gets the name of the key validator with the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - ID
        Returns:
        the name of the key validator with the given id or null if none was found.

      • addKeyValidator

        int addKeyValidator​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                    Validator validator)
             throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                    KeyValidatorExistsException
        Adds a key validator to the database.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        validator - the key validator to add
        Returns:
        the key validator ID as added
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - required access rights are ca_functionality/edit_validator
        KeyValidatorExistsException - if key validator already exists.

      • changeKeyValidator

        void changeKeyValidator​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                        Validator validator)
                 throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                        KeyValidatorDoesntExistsException
        Updates the key validator with the given name.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of administrator.
        validator - the key validator to be modified.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - required access rights are ca_functionality/edit_validator
        KeyValidatorDoesntExistsException - if there's no key validator with the given name.

      • removeKeyValidator

        void removeKeyValidator​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                        String validatorName)
                 throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                        CouldNotRemoveKeyValidatorException
        Removes the key validator data equal if it is not referenced by a CA. If the validatorId does not exist, the method returns without doing anything.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin.
        validatorName - the name of the validator to remove
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - required access rights are ca_functionality/edit_validators
        CouldNotRemoveKeyValidatorException - if the key validator is referenced by other objects.

      • flushKeyValidatorCache

        void flushKeyValidatorCache()
        Flushes the key validators cache to ensure that next time they are read from database.
